content.description: Start underneath the roof on the two jugs and slap up the far left and right arete. While spanning both aretes, find a good right foot and dyno to the lip!
content.location: Compression line on the top of the boulder pile.

content.description: crouch start on jug block at chest height and go straight up. the start is probably underwater at anything other then the lowest flow (`1000 cfs) from folsom dam

Start on the lower tooth of the saw and fenangle your way through a ball sloper to make it to the easier part of the arete. Probably underwater if the cubic feet/second through the dam has been >4000 for a while.
content.location:
38.683380, -121.173049

Big overhung boulder surrounded by water east/upriver of rainbow bridge. Unless you're trying the right-side sit start or the direct, the hands are so good you probably won't need chalk or shoes, so swim/paddle out and send!

content.description: Fall is over water! Drop down onto the second "saw tooth" and muscle up the arete's jugs to an easy mantle at the boulder's highest point. There's often kayakers or kids taking a load off on this picturesque rock, so make sure to grin and say hi as you top out.
content.location:
38.683380, -121.173049

Big overhung boulder surrounded by water east/upriver of rainbow bridge. Unless you're trying the right-side sit start or the direct projects, the hands are so good you probably won't need chalk or shoes, so swim/paddle out and send!

content.description: Start sitting with your left hand under the roof on the left most jug and right hand on the arete, slap up the mini-fridge block. Fun little compression problem!
content.location: Top of the boulder cluster, left most overhanging fridge block.

content.description: Same start as Solitary Refinement, traverse right towards the right arete and dyno to a sloping crimp. Rearrange your feet and commit to a slopey top out.
content.location: After crossing Rainbow Bridge from the parking lot, head right and downhill. Follow the trails to the river. You should be able to see the boulder from the bridge as well.

content.description: Reach up to the jug on the right side of the overhung face and dyno left to the top with a satisfying swing. This has the opposite problem of the sawmill sit, as if the water level is abnormally low, you won't be able to reach the starting hold.
content.location:
38.683380, -121.173049

Right side of the big overhung boulder surrounded by water east/upriver of rainbow bridge. Without a paddleboard/steady kayak it's basically impossible to reach the start, so attempt to FA the gnarly sit at the bottom of the arete or don't bother.

content.description:
Same start as Solitary Refinement. Climb up and left along the arete topping out on jugs.

The landing area may be underwater depending on the time of year.
content.protection: At least 3 pads and a spotter. The crux has back splat potential. There's no way to protect the top out. Be careful.
